intro: Erigeron glabratus, commonly known as the smooth fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, prairies, and disturbed areas, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are generally smooth and gray-green in color, while its flowers are white or pale blue. Erigeron glabratus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
